dialogues.Micah: No, it's not, Marianne.  It hurts so bad.  How did you get chlamydia? Who have you been sleeping with? Tell me! TELL ME!  Olive! Olive Penderghast!     I didn't know what to say! dialogues.Olive: The rumors of my promiscuity have been greatly exaggerated.     Let the record show that I, Olive Penderghast, being of sound mind, ample breast size and the occasional corny knock knock joke, do enter this video blog into evidence in the case against me. Because I'm being judged by a jury of my peers, I will attempt to insert `like' and `totally' into my confession as much as possible. So here it goes... I confess I'm, in no small part, to blame for the vociferous gossip that has turned my Varsity letter scarlet, but - for anyone hoping that the sizzling details of my sordid past will provide you with a reason to lock the door and make love to a dollop of your sister's moisturizing lotion - you'll be gravely disappointed.  Look, I just need to set the record straight and what better way to do that, than to broadcast it on the Internet. So, here it is -- Part One: The Shudder-Inducing and Cliched, However Totally False Account Of How I Lost My Virginity To A Guy At A Community College In A Neighboring Town.  Let me just begin by saying that there are two sides to every story. This is my side, the right one.  Like, totally. 2.  That's bullshit. There are lots of sexy Georges.  Shouldn't that alone be enough?    Superman. From way back. He was hot.  Bullshit. Ben Affleck played him in that movie!  George Stephanopolous.    Well, mine is. So, I think we should just put this conversation to bed.     Let me back up. I don't know if any of you have ever met them, but Rhiannon's parents are quite possibly the creepiest people in a four county radius.  I've always felt sort of sorry for Rhiannon, but not enough to do what she was asking me to do.      Rhi, I can't. I told you I have plans.      (Sympathetic to her  I have a date.    You don't know him.  I'm serious. He goes to the community college with my brother in Denton.       I'm not proud of this. Less about the lie and more about the unoriginality of it. Okay, have you guys ever watched `The Brady Bunch'? Of course you haven't. You're busy watching fake people pretend to be real on MTV. That's why I knew I could get away with it. See, there was this episode where Jan - the awkward middle child - made up a boyfriend to assuage the ridicule of her snatchy sister who had just stolen the heart of the boy that Jan loved. The name of her imaginary boyfriend     George Glass.  He's pretty hot and he asked me out this weekend, so I said yes.  Deal.  I'm sure you'll have a good time.     (Through the proverbial      and olive trees! Olive trees? What a quaint notion... Olive trees. Olive.     But on Monday, when Rhi asked me how my weekend was...  It was nothing short of perfection. 10.  Ryan Gosling, definitely.  He was charming. A real gentleman.  Probably not. It was just one of those weekends.  Yeah.  No, of course not.  I did not.  I'm not that kind of girl.  Okay. Fine. We did it.  Rhi. Blowing Peter Tolliver once behind the Pizza Hut doesn't make you a super-slut.  I started piling on lie after lie. It was like setting up Jenga.  It was... Normal. Nothing freaky. It was sweet. HE was sweet.  No. It was great. Like I said. Okay, that's enough.  So, how was your weekend?      Marianne Bryant, as we all know, is the President of the Christian Student Coalition and is that rare breed of human born with a stick the size of a baseball bat implanted up her anus. God's honest. I'm sure it's in some medical dictionary somewhere.  Last year's cause celebre was the changing of the school mascot, which she spearheaded.  Now, thankfully, we're the much less intimidating --  Meerkat.  Beats the hell out of me. But can we just take a moment to applaud the Barbara Bush High School Marching Band for their very ambitious effort to learn all of the James Bond theme music in a single year? I personally wish them all the best in their endeavor. Ku-dos!  School spirit.  Even dressed as a meerkat, I still fantasize about him.  Communists.  Isn't high school already a hotbed of just that?     So, of course, immediately I knew that the little white lie I told to my then-best-friend in the ladies room would come back to bite me on the ass. However, even I - who my fourth grade teacher stated on my report card `has an imagination that should be quickly expunged' - had no idea how quickly this article of fiction would spread. So, now we move on to Part Two: The Accelerated Velocity of Terminological Inexactitude. 16.  Hey Marianne, can I talk to you for a second?  Listen, what you heard in the bathroom, that wasn't true. It's actually a funny story. Do you ever watch `The Brady Bunch'?    Oh, I have sixteen years worth of anecdotal proof that He does. 17.      I'm swell, guy-I've-never-laid-eyes- on-before. Thanks for asking.  All I could think to myself was `Great, now I'm going to have to start wearing red lipstick and stiletto heels.'  Hey, you guys know that I was here all weekend, right? 18.  And you would testify to that?  It's nothing. Just the rumor mill.  Seriously, it's nothing.  Why? He never comes home.     Like all families, mine has a deep dark secret. And since I'm spilling all this dirt, I might as well go ahead and confess it. 19.  I'm trusting that this nugget of information isn't going to be spread around, but - okay, here it goes: My dad's name is Dill and my mother's name is Rosemary. They were so amused by this that they decided to name all of their children after -- -- edible items.  My brother's name is Sage and my sister's name is Ginger. It's shocking, I know. We're like a fucking pantry, us Penderghasts! But at least my parents didn't meet at a `Star Trek' convention, BITCH! Sorry. Now, I'm just being mean. Okay. Back to the story.  So, while I would never have classified myself as a wallflower, I was now the center of attention and who doesn't love that? Now I have a reason to fix this catastrophe I've brought upon myself. And I'm going to.     You see, now I had a reason for things to go back to the way that they were. 97. Your wife has chlamydia and she's been sleeping with a student and she gave it to him and now she's trying to blame me.  I -- I'm sorry. I --     Looking back, that's the thing I regret the most. That's the thing that sent me to the church, er, churches. And that's the thing that made me realize how profoundly I'd fucked up. 100.  And that's something I'll have to live with for the rest of my life. With my words, even though they were true, I ended a marriage. No kid should have to be burdened with that.  I'm so sorry.  Me too. Where are you going?  Can I come?     Mr. Griffin, if you ever see this, just know - I was wrong to tell you that. In that way. At all. I don't know. I shouldn't have done it. I don't feel bad for lying for your wife. But I hate myself for telling you the truth. I'm so sorry.  Part Five: Not With a Whimper But With a Bang.         Oh fuck me. He's disgusting!  So, the sins of the mother are revisited on the daughter.  I hate you so much right now. Can't you see I'm a mess!  Thanks for the pep talk, Mom. Now get out. I need to make some phone calls.  Nobody does it better. Makes me feel sad for the rest. Nobody does it half as good as me. Baby, I'm the best.  I wasn't lookin,' But somehow they found me. I tried to hide from Your love light. But like heaven above me The guys who loved me Are keepin' all my secrets safe tonight.  And nobody does it better Though sometimes I wish someone could. Baby, baby! Darlin', I'm the best!  Baby you're the best! Darlin', you're the best! Baby, you're the best!   This is just a free preview. Not that I owe any of you any more confessions, but I'm really in love with him. And I am going to lose my virginity to him. I'm not sure when. It could happen five minutes from now or tonight or six months from now or maybe on our wedding night, but the really amazing thing is that it's nobody's business.  Like, totally.
dialogues.Marianne: Nothing. Just a couple of admitted whores.  How can we exhibit school pride when we're conveyed to others as satan worshippers? 14.    Olive - that's your name, right?  I'm not the one you have to answer to for your depraved behavior. There is a higher power to judge your indecency.    Look. You've made your bed. I just hope for your sake, you cleaned the sheets.  Seems as if someone's on a downward spiral.  You have a chip on your shoulder the size of Texas.    Oh, I can assure you I won't.  I hope you at least had the good sense to wear a condom.  You know, you're just like --  Heavenly Father, watch over us with Your all-encompassing love. Keep us on the path toward Your righteousness and eternal salvation.  Guys. We have a problem.  Olive Penderghast. We need to pray for her, but we also need to get rid of her. I'm sure, by now, you've all heard about what happened at Melanie Bostic's party. dialogues.Principal: I don't know you. 26.  Why are we just now meeting? Using language like this should have warranted a visit to me years ago.  This is foul. NOW.

description: After a little white lie about losing her virginity gets out, a clean cut high school girl sees her life paralleling Hester Prynne's in "The Scarlet Letter," which she is currently studying in school - until she decides to use the rumor mill to advance her social and financial standing.Sony Pictures
name: Easy A
